# init(edgeLoopFrom:)

**Initializer**

Creates an edge loop from a rectangle.

## Declaration

```swift
init(edgeLoopFrom rect: CGRect)
```

## Parameters

- **rect**: The rectangle that defines the edges. The rectangle is specified relative to the owning nodeâ€™s origin.

## Return Value

A new edge-based physics body.

## Discussion

An edge has no volume or mass and is always treated as if the [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKPhysicsBody/isDynamic] property is equal to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false]. Edges may only collide with volume-based physics bodies.

## Creating an Edge-Based Physics Body

- **Creating an Edge Loop Around a Scene**: Border your scene with an obstacle that physics bodies cannot penetrate.
- **init(edgeFrom:to:)**: Creates an edge between two points.
- **init(edgeLoopFrom:)**: Creates an edge loop from a path.
- **init(edgeChainFrom:)**: Creates an edge chain from a path.
